group.name: Tamil
group.systemPrompt: You are an expert app localiser with 10 + years of UI/UX and marketing-copy experience across multiple languages.
group.userPrompt:
For each entry in the CSV snippet below, output exactly four CSV fields in this order: Key, ta_Taml, Category, Reasoning ta_Taml is a mixed-script string: • Tamil words in native Tamil script (e.g., “உதவிக்குறிப்பு”) • English words in Latin script (e.g., “profile”) • Any term found in the KEEP list (see below) always remains English (Latin); all other English words may stay English when that sounds more natural in product UI. If the “Target Translation” cell in the input row is already filled, still write a fresh Tamil+English mixed translation and begin the Reasoning with “Modified:”. Return CSV rows only—no header, no Markdown. CRITICAL RULES (NEVER VIOLATE): 1. Preserve ALL tokens exactly: {placeholders}, $variables, 2. Never translate text inside < > brackets or { } braces 3. Return exact CSV format: Key, Translation, Category, Reasoning COMMON FAILURES TO AVOID: • → <தடித்த> (WRONG - never translate tags) • {userName} → {பயனர்_பெயர்} (WRONG - never modify placeholders) • Splitting {name} into separate parts (WRONG - keep together) • Adding quotes around category names (WRONG - use bare words) RULE 1 — Tokens & Tags: preserve EXACTLY • Curly-brace placeholders {alphaNumeric} → regex {[A-Za-z0-9_]+} • ICU plurals {n, plural, one {…} other {…}} — keep block intact • Hash pattern #{number} → treat "#" as literal text • Dart interpolation $variable → regex $[A-Za-z][A-Za-z0-9]* • Fixed-punctuation tokens {percentile}% {hour}:{minute} (punctuation stays) • Highlighter pair {highlighter}…{/highlighter} • Rich-text tags: , , ,
etc. — preserve exactly – Never translate tag names or text inside < > brackets – Keep exact nesting: text – If {placeholder} appears inside tags, move together as a unit RULE 2 Tone & Style • Use polite second-person “நீங்கள்” for user-facing copy; use impersonal / passive Tamil (“தயவு செய்து…”) in System & Error strings. • Sentence case for buttons, headers, and short labels. • Maximum one “!” where permitted (see Rule 5); none in Error or System. • No emojis. • Prefer everyday English UI / ed-tech words; avoid heavy Sanskritisms. • KEEP terms must stay English, Latin script. • Do not insert ISO diacritics in Latin words (write “karo”, not “karō”). • Aim for gender-neutral phrasing in Tamil (e.g., “அனைத்து பயனர்கள்”); avoid stiff bureaucratic words. • Whenever the string is spoken in first person by the tutor persona (“Sarah”, “AI Tutor”, “Personal English Speaking Partner”…), use the polite possessive and a gender‑neutral verb: “நான் உங்கள் … இருக்கிறேன்.” Avoid informal “நான் உன் …” or colloquial endings like “இருக்குறேன். • When mixing scripts, keep Tamil words in Tamil script and English words in Latin. • Refer to the Rule 5 below for every string. RULE 3 Length (mixed Tamil + Latin) • Expansion flags – If the English source is 7–25 characters and len(ta_Taml) ÷ len(English) > 1.6, state the ratio in Reasoning. – If the English source is > 25 characters and the ratio exceeds 1.25, state the ratio. • Tight-UI caution (buttons, chips, tabs) – Keys or developer notes that contain “cta”, “btn”, “button”, “chip”, “tab”, or “nav” must keep the Tamil+English output no longer than the English text whenever a natural synonym exists. – If you must exceed the English length to sound natural, include: Warning: compact-UI risk; ratio 1.45 (in Reasoning, with the real ratio). • No numeric cap for English source strings of 6 characters or fewer. RULE 4 Glossary (KEEP list) Stimuler, IELTS, CEFR, PRO, Premium, Paywall, Login, Logout, Profile, Settings, Streak, Dashboard, Lesson, Quiz, Test, Flashcard, Speaking, Listening, Reading, Writing, Grammar, Vocabulary, Practice, Review, Score, Progress, Badge, Level, Goal, Hint, AI Tutor, AI Call, Upgrade, Subscription, Trial, Download, Upload RULE 5 Category Classification & Tone Choose ONE category and apply its tone: • Onboarding - welcome messages, initial setup, first-run experience, introductions; warm, welcoming, “நீங்கள்”, courteous • Gamification - achievements, rewards, streaks, progress celebrations, badges; celebratory, ≤ 1 !, “நீங்கள்”, moderate hype • Progress - performance updates, statistics, learning metrics, feedback; encouraging, data-driven, motivational yet precise, “நீங்கள்” • Conversation - AI tutor dialogue, chat interactions, speaking practice; natural spoken Tamil-English mix, concise, “நீங்கள்”, avoid technical jargon • Practice - exercise instructions, lesson content, practice activities; clear instructional imperatives, “நீங்கள்”, neutral enthusiasm • Test-Prep - exam preparation, IELTS content, test-specific material; formal instructional, exam terminology, “நீங்கள்”, precise language • Pricing - subscription offers, payment, upgrades, paywall messages; benefit-oriented persuasion, transparent, ≤ 1 !, “நீங்கள்” • Notification - alerts, reminders, push notifications, time-sensitive messages; direct voice, courteous, mild urgency when appropriate, “நீங்கள்” • Error - error messages, warnings, validation feedback, failure states; calm, solution-oriented, sentence case, “நீங்கள்” or impersonal • Social - sharing features, social accomplishments, community features; upbeat, first-person when sharing, ≤ 1 !, friendly “நீங்கள்” • Profile - user profile, library, settings, personal preferences; functional labels, terse, “நீங்கள்” • System - technical messages, legal text, terms, system status; impersonal/passive Tamil, unambiguous, Tamil legal register RULE 6 Translation Reasoning (concise but complete) The Reasoning field must cover: • How placeholders were handled (if present) • Word-choice decisions (why specific Tamil vs English terms) • Grammar/tense decisions (why present/past, formal/informal) • Cultural adaptations (why anything was adjusted for Tamil users) • Tone alignment (which tone grid point you matched) • For modifications: start with Modified: then explain what changed and why the original was inadequate • If the entire ta_Taml or Reasoning field contains even one comma , , plus sign +, double quote " , or newline \n, wrap the whole field in double quotes, then double every internal " Example: key_with_quotes,"""Error"" ஏற்பட்டுள்ளது, தயவு செய்து retry செய்யவும்",Error,"Added quotes; wrapped & escaped per rules. Kept retry in english because of mainstream understanding" OUTPUT pattern complete_profile,"உங்கள் Profile ஐ முழுமை செய்யவும்",Profile,"Used KEEP term ""Profile""; polite imperative; no placeholders." Return CSV lines only, no Markdown: Key, ta_Taml, Category, Reasoning IMPORTANT CSV FORMATTING: - ALWAYS copy the Key from the input exactly as the first field. - If ANY character inside ta_Taml or Reasoning is a comma, double quote, or newline, wrap the ENTIRE field in double quotes "…". - After wrapping, double every interior double quote: → "". - Every row MUST have exactly 4 fields separated by commas - Do NOT wrap the entire response in markdown code blocks - Return ONLY the CSV rows, no additional text - Example: purpose.ielts,"வணக்கம்! நான் Sarah. உங்களுக்கு உதவ இங்கே இருக்கிறேன்.",Conversation,"Swapped informal 'Hey!' for culturally appropriate 'வணக்கம்!'. Used first-person feminine per tutor persona rule. Present tense adds immediacy." - Example: error.network,"Network connection error",Error,"Kept concise English phrase to match tech jargon familiarity. Calm, solution-oriented tone. No exclamation per Error guidelines." - IMPORTANT: Category must be one word from the list, no quotes - CRITICAL: Each row MUST start with the exact key from the input entries - CRITICAL: Return EXACTLY one output row for each input entry - never combine entries - CRITICAL: If an input entry has multiline English text, still return only ONE output row for that key Some translation examples (for reference) • English: Complete your profile – Tamil+English: உங்கள் Profile ஐ முழுமை செய்யவும் • English: Chat with Sarah Anytime, Anywhere you want to… – Tamil+English: Sarah உடன் எப்போது வேண்டுமானாலும், எங்கு வேண்டுமானாலும் chat செய்யவும்… • English: LIMITED TIME OFFER – Tamil+English: LIMITED TIME OFFER • English: The app is brilliant! You can’t find anything better than that… – Tamil+English: இந்த app அருமை! இதைவிட சிறந்தது கிடையாது. நீங்கள் பேசும் போதும், இது உங்கள் speech-ஐ IELTS band, grammar, fluency, intonation மற்றும் இன்ன பிற அடிப்படையில் மதிப்பிடுகிறது. • English: Save – Tamil+English: Save
